File IO¶

Tools for reading in files

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.dirname_n_times(path, n=1)¶

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.walk(main_dir)¶
Returns a list of files
Slightly faster than recursive_walk

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.read_folder_as_dict(dirpath, ext='.sql')¶
Enter the path of a directory, the folders become keys, text files become values
Nested directories become nested keys

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.read_json(filepath, debug=False)¶

Retrieves figure from hardcoded path


harrison_functions.utils.file_io.read_csv_as_json(csv_file)¶
Input:
[header1, header2, ...]
[data1, data2, ...]
Output: 
'[{"header1": "data1",
   "header2": "data2", 
   ...}
  ...]'
Parses QD objects from LIMS

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.read_csv_from_txt(filepath, encoding='utf-16', sep='\t', skiprows: int = None, nrows: int = None, skipcols: int = None, ncols: int = None, index: list = None, columns: list = None)¶
Convenience function for reading text files where csv may be embedded
Use the following settings for 96-well plates:
df = read_csv_from_txt(
    filepath,
    skiprows=3, nrows=8,
    skipcols=2, ncols=12,
    index=[i for i in string.ascii_uppercase[:8]],
    columns=[i for i in range(1, 13)],
)
Could come back and add header and index identifiers

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.read_section_from_ini(filepath, section='default')¶

To be used with conf/settings.ini


harrison_functions.utils.file_io.read_ini_as_dict(filepath, ini_key=None, sections=[])¶

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.connection_uri_from_ini(filepath, section='postgres', ini_key=None, username=None, password=None, host=None, port=None, db_name=None)¶
Given an INI file with a [‘postgres’] section
Returns the sqlalchemy connection args
Make sure the config.ini file exists in your project

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.create_nested_folder(current_dir, new_dir)¶
current_dir = data/folder_1/folder_2
new_dir = folder_3/folder_4
Output: data/folder_1/folder_2/folder_3/folder_4

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.recursive_zip(main_dir)¶
Zips all individual items in a folder structure
If item is a file and not .zip, zip it
Else if item is a subdirectory, repeat

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.recursive_unzip(main_dir)¶
Unzips all individual items in a folder structure
If item is a file and .zip, unzip it
Else if item is a subdirectory, repeat

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.recursive_rm(main_dir, ext)¶
Removes all files in a folder structure with a given extension
If item is a file with extension ext
Else if item is a subdirectory, repeat

harrison_functions.utils.file_io.read_gzipped_tsv(path, strip='!\n', sep='\t')¶

Use this to read a single file


harrison_functions.utils.file_io.unzip_gzipped_file(path)¶

Use this to unzip a single file
